channel.title: Need Help, Badly!
channel.description:
My Client doesn't connect to Loacalhost 127.0.0.1. I have tried 5 Different Clients, each one having the same error. I downloaded an IP-Changer on one Computer, and it worked perfectly. I took a Blank CD and put the Client on the Disk, and brought it to my house. When the Client started up, the Client wouldn't connect to Localhost, but it did on the other Computer that I tried it on.
Can somone please help, it's been like this for about almost 2 Months now.

item.title: Need Help, Badly!
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Or mayb hes not running server ?

Read full topic

hey calm down guy it could solve it maybe he has another local ip

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help, Badly!
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

LOL, are you both dumb? ipconfig does not give him a problem fix for this. The problem you are having is through your internal computer. Just use your servers ip adress like you said worked. If that doesnt work, try rebooting the client and try again, if still no then find a new client lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help, Badly!
item.dc:creator: @sodanakin sodanakin
item.description:
@sodanakin wrote:

go to start and open cmd
there u write ipconfig u will see your ip there

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help, Badly!
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Wow Thats Tricky, If you have a router your ip may be like 192.168.0.2 or other, check your router settings and its ip.

Read full topic
